author: VNExplorer
title: El sérum antiedad más eficaz de vitmina C que le copié a mi madre
text:
Con el paso de los años, uno de los factores que más nos preocupan es la aparición de las primeras arrugas y líneas de expresión en nuestro rostro que evidencien la huella del envejecimiento. Para prevenirlas y completar nuestra rutina de cuidado facial de noche, te recomendamos cuál es el sérum más completo que debes incorporar a tu skincare de forma inmediata.
Ahora que llega el buen tiempo y, con él, aumentan nuestras horas de exposición al sol, necesitamos proteger nuestra piel con más cuidados que nunca para evitar que las radiaciones ultravioletas impacten en nuestro rostro de forma nociva y aumenten nuestras arrugas y líneas de expresión, creando manchas que generen que nuestra piel luzca irregular y con demasiadas imperfecciones.
La clave durante el día es aplicarnos SPF 50+. No debemos olvidarnos de él cada vez que nos levantemos y completemos nuestra rutina de cuidado facial, es vital aplicarlo antes de salir a la calle, aunque esté nublado, y llevarlo en nuestro bolso por si vamos a ir a una terracita o nos vamos a exponer demasiado al sol.
¿Y por la noche? Cuando nos vamos a dormir es cuando más conscientes debemos ser a la hora de cuidar nuestra piel ya que, al descansar y estar en reposo y sin luz, nuestra piel está más susceptible a recibir los tratamientos que nos aplicamos. Mi madre me recomendó el sérum perfecto para luchar contra los signos de la edad y que además hidrata la piel. Después de probarlo durante semanas, este ha transformado mi piel irritada a una mucho más luminosa (algo que parecía imposible de conseguir debido a mi cutis seco). El famoso producto es el sérum de Pure Vitamin C10 de La Roche Possay y lo puedes encontrar en Primor o en Druni.
¿CÓMO ES EL SÉRUM ANTIEDAD MÁS EFECTIVO DE LA ROCHE POSSAY?
La Roche Possay
pure vitamin c10
30,99€ 48,40€ Ver más
Este sérum está formulado ácido L-ascórbico, es decir, Vitamina C pura, en su fórmula biológica más intensa, conocida por su capacidad para mejorar la luminosidad y la textura de la piel, un ingrediente que el cuerpo humano es incapaz de generar y que solo puede conseguir mediante la ingesta externa. También cuenta con neurosensina calmante y ácido salicílico, que favorecen la penetración de esta Vitamina C y potencian su eficacia.
Todos estos ingredientes están formulados con un pH fisiológico y hacen que este sérum sea ideal para todo tipo de pieles, incluso las más sensibles, no es comedogénico y los dermatólogos lo recomiendan. Aporta luminosidad a la piel, mejorando su calidad, y combate los signos del envejecimiento, difuminando las líneas de expresión para ayudar a conseguir una piel firme y refinada. Es recomendable aplicarlo por la noche en el rostro y en el cuello, evitando acercarnos al contorno del ojo para evitar que se irrite.
La Roche Posay
Otros sérums antiedad con Vitamina C que debemos conocer Una alternativa llega con el Sérum Liposomal C-VIT Sesderma, formulado con Vitamina C estable, extracto de morera, ácido hialurónico liposomado, syncoll y pantenol liposomado. Proporciona luminosidad, firmeza y un tono unificado de la piel y cuenta con activos concentrados para luchar contra el envejecimiento y la pigmentación. Es ideal también como tratamiento para las cicatrices y las estrías, lucha contra el fotoenvejecimiento del cutis y es perfecto para todo tipo de pieles, incluso las más sensibles y aquellas que padecen rosacea.
ECI
Sérum Liposomal C-VIT Sesderma
33,55€Ver más
Formulado con Vitamina C pura y enriquecido con Vitamina E, para proteger la piel del estrés oxidativo, y ácido salicílico, para reducir los poros y alisar la piel. Este sérum de L`Oréal reduce la aparición de las líneas de expresión, difuminando las ya existentes y aporta luminosidad a la piel, mejorando su textura, logrando un tono más uniforme en tan solo un mes y ayudando a que se vea más hidratada, lisa y luminosa.

author: Rowan Lynam
title: The Best Serum Deals to Shop on Vitamin C Day
text:
It’s
National Vitamin C Day, and in celebration of our brightening, collagen-boosting bestie, brands are dropping prices and giving free gifts you don’t want to miss. Able to combat signs of aging, vitamin C is a must-have step in your regular skin-care routine. And now is the perfect time to snag them!
Some of our favorite brands are shouting out some of our favorite formulas, but the clock is ticking on these special deals. We’ve collected our favorites so you can pack your cart with the best in brightening before time runs out!
The Top Vitamin C Day Sales
Timeless Skin Careis offering a treat for your skin with 40 percent off on April 4 with code VITC. Dermalogicais gifting their brightening trio, Powerbright Dark Spot Serum, BioLumin-C Serum, and Daily Glycolic Cleanser, on orders $75+. No code needed! TruSkin’ssale is on its entire Vitamin C skin-care collection. Running on Amazon only, the discounts will last through the end of the day today! Its best-selling Vitamin C Serum and SPF 30 Mineral Sunscreen with Vitamin C are up to 45 percent off. RoCis celebrating National Vitamin C Day with 15 percent off clinically proven Vitamin C skin care. SkinCeuticalsis also running a limited-time offer in celebration of Vitamin C Day. The gift of your choice of mini Vitamin C serum is a $91 value and is available on orders of $225 or more.
The Best in Vitamin C Products
TruSkin Vitamin C Face Serum ($22, usually $49)
TruSkin is offering 45 percent off its entire Vitamin C collection, and that includes the much-loved Vitamin C Face Serum, which has over 148,700 glowing
Amazon reviews. The hydrating formula also includes hyaluronic acid and aloe vera to soothe and refresh skin. SkinCeuticals C E Ferulic ($182)
A patented formula
loved by dermatologists, this serum improves the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, loss of firmness, and brightens skin’s complexion. 15 percent pure vitamin C (L-ascorbic acid) works to address skin concerns and protect skin from environmental damage. Create the ultimate vitamin C-powered skin-care routine with this key step and get your choice of mini vitamin C serum on orders of $225 or more. Dermalogica Biolumin-C Vitamin C Serum ($39)
If you’re filling your cart for those sweet free gifts, look no further than the Biolumin-C Vitamin C Serum. Packed with lactic acid, vitamin C and inflammation-reducing chia seed extract, this serum does the work without putting your skin through the ringer.
timeless Skincare 20% Vitamin C + E Ferulic Acid ($27, usually $35)
Brighten, boost and protect your skin with this bestselling 20% Vitamin C formula. With over 9,000 reviews, this serum is much-loved for the lightweight, non-greasy formula.
ROĆ x SJP Brightening Trio with Vitamin C (Sale price $75, usually $103)
Snag the exclusive skin-care set and bag, designed by
Sarah Jessica Parker, and powered by vitamin C. Including the Revive + Glow Serum, Eye Balm, and Moisturizer with SPF 30, this set tackles all your biggest pigmentation and fine line concerns.

author: Jagjeet Singh Sareen
title: Sustainable Living: Jagjeet Singh Sareen Of Dalberg Advisors On Recognising Individual Vulnerability Of Climate Change - Forbes India
text:
India’s farmers, 78 percent of who have small holdings, face challenges such as water scarcity and the threat of unsustainable agricultural practices Image: In Pictures Ltd. / Corbis Via Getty Images
T he election heat may have subsided in India, but the scorching heat of climate change is just beginning to sear. Extreme weather events—such as droughts, floods and heatwaves—have become more commonplace, adversely impacting people’s health, productivity and income. These effects are disproportionally felt by vulnerable segments of the population, such as the urban poor and small-holder farmers. Additionally, as India makes strides in its decarbonisation efforts by doubling down on renewable energy, there are growing concerns regarding reliable access and affordability of energy, as well as larger questions of equitable access to economic opportunities, equity and justice. As the unequal impact of climate change becomes increasingly evident, it is crucial to reassess how we implement measures to effectively tackle these concerns.
Related stories How are India's power companies handling the crucial renewables transition? India needs to create jobs, and they have to be green Climate change is wreaking havoc in India. It needs clarity and action now We need to recognise that the vulnerability of individuals and communities to the impacts of climate change is influenced by the interactions of local, state, and national actors and actions. Therefore, it is essential to take a comprehensive and systems approach. We require policies and implementation measures that aim for transformative adaptation, resilience, and mitigation to fundamentally transition all sectors of our economy. These policies and implementation measures must prioritise people’s lives and livelihoods as a fundamental principle. It is important to consider how this transition can be centered around improving the lives and livelihoods of people.
Green Transition & Human Cost India has already committed to ambitious decarbonisation targets: Increasing its renewable energy capacity to 500 GW by 2030 and reaching carbon neutrality by 2070. It is now pushing ahead with electrifying all sectors of the economy and greening the electricity, aided by the ramped-up use of green hydrogen and biomass-based fuels.
However, without a people-first approach, decarbonisation and energy transition efforts could negatively impact lives, livelihoods and natural ecosystems. Additionally, fiscal policies (EU’s Green Deal, US’s Inflation Reduction Act and green industries’ subsidies) and trade measures (like the EU’s Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanisms) adopted by developed nations could also have disproportionate and negative impacts on economic growth and livelihoods of the people in India.
India requires hundreds of billions of dollars in investments by 2030 and beyond to meet its solar, wind, hydrogen, bioenergy, and green mobility targets. As these sectors expand, tensions over resources will likely amplify, particularly over land and water, affecting millions of farmers. Despite this, many financiers still view renewable energy as fully sustainable, and continued investments may perpetuate existing socioeconomic inequalities.
Acting now could turn the energy transition into an opportunity for broader socioeconomic transformation. Across the value chain, various actors, from policymakers to developers, can come together to drive this green transition towards responsible renewable energy.
National and state-level people-centric energy transition plans should collectively bring economic growth, jobs and livelihood opportunities. For green industrialisation, India needs to go beyond production-linked incentive schemes and push for localising manufacturing for renewable energy and green mobility. This requires building the necessary green industrial, financing and skills ecosystem. The workforce dependent on carbon-intensive sources, like the coal value chain, should be adequately compensated and reskilled to support energy transition and green industrialisation. We must also be mindful that increasing the burden of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) reporting and reducing Scope 3 emissions could be a constraint for the growth of MSMEs, which contribute significantly to economic and social development. Hence, it is critical to support green business models and ease access to green credit for MSMEs as key enablers of green industrialisation.
Also read: From advocacy to awareness: Women-led communities are finding their voice in the climate space
Key Role of Financiers Given their ability to influence developers and other value chain actors, financiers have a key role to play in enabling a just transition. While they are showing some signs of climate awareness, it is often limited to meeting ESG requirements. Knowledge of financial and technical solutions, and the ability to implement and monitor them remains a challenge.
Fiscal regulators have an important role to play. In the past year, the Reserve Bank of India and the Securities and Exchange Board of India have come forward with climate physical risk and ESG disclosure requirements and nudged financial sector entities to undertake climate stress tests. While these are welcome steps, one needs to be mindful that the risk mitigation efforts undertaken by financial sector players are likely to have a disproportionate impact on incomes and livelihoods of vulnerable segments of the population with potentially higher interest rates, increased costs of climate-proofing, and higher insurance premiums.
Urban Poor & Farmers: Worst Affected The urban poor are among the groups that are particularly at risk from climate change, despite contributing minimally to its causes. It is estimated that climate risks could increase India’s national poverty rate by 3.5 percent, leading to an additional 50 million people falling into poverty by 2040. Climate change poses risks to nutrition, health, education, livelihoods, housing, WASH, and financial safety nets. However, existing programmes often fail to fully address the interconnected ways in which climate challenges affect their lives. Adaptation and resilience solutions for the urban poor should span across various sectors and avoid isolated and short-term thinking.
India’s farmers too have been severely affected by climate change in recent years, and these effects are expected to worsen. Small-holder farmers, comprising 78 percent, produce 41 percent of the country’s food grains. Farmers face challenges such as water scarcity and the threat of unsustainable agricultural practices. The increasing frequency of extreme weather events, such as droughts and floods, also pose significant challenges, potentially causing a 20 to 25 percent decline in medium-term incomes if not addressed promptly. These challenges, if left unaddressed, could further endanger the future of Indian agriculture and lead to increased climate-linked rural-to-urban displacement.
Any climate-smart intervention needs to consider the interests of these two groups front and centre, with affordable and scalable solutions. It is imperative to mitigate their losses if we wish to achieve a people-centred transition to a green era. Ensuring these groups can prosper in a green era should be as much of a priority as tackling climate change.

author: 蕃新聞
title: 亞大護理學獲教育部補助，深耕職輔教育有成
text:
亞大護理學獲教育部補助，深耕職輔教育有成
(中央社訊息服務20250612 14:41:26)亞洲大學護理學院自2021年起，持續獲教育部「大專校院推動職涯輔導補助計畫」補助106萬元，將職涯輔導教材融入於護理、長照專業課程，從2021年護理系「白衣天使導航起飛」職輔計畫，有5門課程、11個單元開始，到今年擴展為全院參與的「生成式AI打造健康照護高效職航力」職輔計畫，涵蓋9門課程、16個單元，展現深耕職涯教育的豐碩成果。
亞大護理學院長吳樺姍表示，全國照護人力拮据，護理、長照教育單位不僅是人才養成的重要源地，也是建構未來健康照護人員長遠職涯發展願景的起點。該學院各系將職涯發展概念，帶入護理學導論、基本護理學、公共衛生概論等基礎專業課程，並逐步延伸至各科專業課程及臨床實習，引導學生探索職涯方向。
吳樺姍院長指出，由她和護理系績優職涯導師洪慧容、學士後護理系職涯導師李慧琦、長期照護系職涯導師鄭韻如，共同規劃學院各系所年度職涯輔導計畫，完成職輔教材融入課程及辦理多元職輔活動。其中，2022年的「醫養社跨專業合作共創職涯新契機」職輔計畫，曾獲選為優良特色計畫。
此外，也結合亞大護理學院獲勞動部、教育部大學社會責任實踐(USR)計畫資源，辦理企業參訪、職涯演講、系友分享、典範人物訪談及心得競賽等活動，提供護理學院各系學生多元接觸不同健康照護場域的機會與資源。根據2021到2025年畢業生流向調查顯示，護理學院各系學生畢業滿1年，仍留任於醫療保健產業的比率高達93%~96%。
吳樺姍院長說，值得一提的是，護理學院將AI元宇宙導入職涯輔導，去年辦理護理職涯VR教案製作工作坊，師生協作完成5部VR教材，並舉辦競賽，讓同學在跨域學習中，深入思考自身的職涯定位與專業成長需求。
今年則進一步設計將生成式AI應用於職涯輔導教材，如：在基本護理學課程「壓力調適」單元，結合「職場減壓沒煩惱」教材，引導同學運用Chat GPT作為紓壓暖心小夥伴提供心理支持；在「關懷與溝通」課程中，融合「職涯視窗六宮格」教材，讓同學透過Copilot繪製職涯概念圖像；在「典範人物訪談影片製作工作坊」中，指導同學運用Chat GPT協撰訪綱、引發深入提問與反思。
吳樺姍院長提到，目前亞大護理系已成立智慧護理特色系組，開設智慧護理微學程，導向「資訊護理師」就業職類。未來，亞洲大學護理學院將持續導入智慧科技與創新教材於職涯教育中，培養學生成為具備專業素養與前瞻視野的智慧照護人才。

author: Rafael Manuel Tovar
title: USA: Call for Prison Sentence for Individual Who Decapitated Sculpture of Satan
text: (ZENIT News / Iowa, 27.12.2023).- Michael Cassidy, a Christian and former military officer pushed the statue of Baphomet from the Satanic scene erected in the Capitol of the State of Iowa, and decapitated the statue of the satanic image. He was arrested and charged with “fourth degree felony,” according to Iowa’s Public Security Department. The statue was part of the scene set up, with official authorization, in the Capitol of the State of Iowa. The decapitated head was thrown into the garbage. Cassidy destroyed the statue to “wake up Christians to the anti-Christian acts promoted by our government.” He also said that the existence of the “satanic scene” was a provocative sample during Christmas. It was set up by the Satanic Temple’s Association, which has been recognized legally since 2013 as a religious organization. Strangely, the Association says it doesn’t believe in God or in the devil or in supernatural beings. It uses symbolisms and themes that annoy Christians, such as the diabolic, abortion and blasphemy, described as expressions of freedom. This representation was coloured during Christmas in red and black, with black candles and a figure with a goat’s head and beard called Baphomet, one of Satan’s names. The networks published messages wishing “Happy Saturnalia and Yule for all.” Michael Cassidy, 35, former pilot of the U.S. Navy and civil test pilot, destroyed the controversial montage, which was criticized by many. His action was described as a minor felony, but he faces a year in prison and a US$2,560 fine. He asked for financial support on the Internet to cover the fine and his defense in court. In just one night, he collected US$40,000, which three days later rose to US$75,000. “My conscience is at the service of the Word of God, not of bureaucratic decrees. So I acted,” he said. He will give the money leftover from legal expenses to “a Christian legal fund.” Cassidy also said: “My most profound hope is that Americans of all political persuasions can unite and be in agreement that: one, Jesus Christ is Lord; two, that Satan is the Evil One.” And he stressed the limits of freedom of expressions when it comes to the honour of God: ”To Christians that defend satanic altars when they talk with their friends, relatives, in their church, to colleagues or on X . . . would you use the same argument if you were talking with God?” Referring to satanists, he said they defend “profoundly held beliefs” and “reject arbitrary authority (. . .). The world can tell Christians to accept submissively Satan’s legitimacy, but none of the Founding Fathers would have considered that the Government’s sanction to satanic altars inside Capitol buildings would be protected by the First Amendment . . . . Anti-Christian values have spread constantly over the last decades, and Christians have behaved as the proverbial frog in boiling water.” The police arrested Cassidy after he handed himself over to the officers in the building. Iowa’s Satanic Temple, author of the scene in the State Capitol intends to file a complaint for fourth degree damages. ”I saw this blasphemous statue and I was indignant,” said Cassidy

author: Viransh Shah
title: Virat Kohli fails to fire again as Ranji Trophy comeback hype vanishes into thin air
text:
Cricket News
Virat Kohli fails to fire again as Ranji Trophy comeback hype vanishes into thin air
Virat Kohli's comeback to Ranji Trophy was met with disappointment after the senior player failed to play an impactful knock for Delhi in the first innings against Railway in the Elite Group D match at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.
New Delhi: The raucous crowd at the Arun Jaitley Stadium was brought to silence after Virat Kohli was dismissed for just six runs in his Ranji Trophy comeback game for Delhi against Railways. This was a big disappointment for many as the excitement was crushed.
If Railways pacer Himanshu Sangwan has admired Australian skipper Pat Cummins at any point of his career then he would have certainly enjoyed that moment. Watching the crowd go silent. It was that one exemplary delivery that sent the off-stump of Kohli for a ride.
[pic.twitter.com/9yHaMc69BM]— Follow @Legenddhonii (@fuckusuar_)[January 31, 2025]
Kohli walked back to the dugout after adding just six runs from 15 deliveries he faced in an innings in domestic cricket, which he played after 12 long years. It was the fuller length with a straight ball which came in slightly to expose the bat and pad gap before the off-stump was on a trip with a cartwheeling move.
The non-home crowd factor
The wait to watch the senior cricketer didn’t justify with the player not being able to adapt to the conditions, which he dominated in the formative years of his career. The dejection was quite evident as the crowd left the stands because they had come to watch Kohli do his magic with his willow. The joy lasted for only one boundary that came just before the dismissal.
It was for that moment when the crowd were eagerly waiting for either of Yash Dhull or Sanat Sangwan to depart. The uuhs and aahs were audible whenever Dhull’s edge went through the slip cordon. It was that tangibility to watch the icon at the crease more than the cause of Delhi team bagging a substantial lead. In the lexicons of cricket, with the most idealistic way, the crowd should be termed as the home crowd, but than it was pulled by the aura of one player. And the stands were emptied the moment that player was dismissed.
Click for more latest Cricket news. Also get top headlines and latest news from India and around the world at News9.

author: Sunil Dhawan
title: To be eligible for Singapore Employment Pass, foreign workers must earn a higher salary from 2025
text: Foreign employees will have to meet a higher salary threshold before starting employment in Singapore beginning next year. The Singapore Employment Pass (EP) qualifying salary for applications will be raised upwards from January 1, 2025, for new, renewals, and those expiring from January 2026.Foreign professionals, managers and executives need to secure a Singapore Employment Pass before working in Singapore. To apply for a Singapore Employment Pass (EP), an employer in Singapore or appointed employment agent must apply on behalf of the foreign employee.To qualify for EP applications, foreign workers need to pass a 2-stage eligibility:The 2-stage eligibility framework applies to new EP applications from 1 September 2023, and renewals of EPs expired from 1 September 2024. Foreign workers need to meet the pre-defined income criteria before getting the Singapore Employment Pass. To be eligible for the Employment Pass, foreign employees need to earn at least $5,000 a month in Singapore.The Fixed monthly salary of the foreign worker to be employed by the employer in Singapore has to be comparable to the top one-third of local professionals, managers, executives and Technicians (PMET) salaries.Employment Pass salary benchmark starts from $5,000 with age from 23 and increases progressively with age, up to $10,500 for those aged 45 and above.To be eligible, workers in the financial services industry must earn more money .From 1 January 2025, the EP qualifying salary for new applications will be revised to at least $5,600, and at least $6,200 for the financial services sector. This revised EP qualifying salary will also apply to the renewal of EPs that are expiring from 1 January 2026.The second criteria for EP makes it mandatory for foreign workers to pass the points-based Complementarity Assessment Framework (COMPASS). Your application needs to earn 40 points to pass COMPASS.Those who do not meet the salary benchmark are not eligible for an EP, regardless of the points they would have scored under COMPASS.The pass duration for first-time candidates is up to 2 years, renewals up to 3 years, and experienced tech professionals with shortage skills may receive a longer 5-year pass.Singapore may also issue an employment pass, which shall be known as a training employment pass, to a foreigner who is receiving or is about to receive training in connection with the occupation, trade or business of his employer.In addition, one cap applies for the Personalised Employment Pass which is for high-earning Employment Pass holders and overseas foreign professionals. It is not tied to an employer and offers greater flexibility than an Employment Pass.The Blue Zones are five regions with low rates of chronic disease, where people live longer and healthier lives due to physical activity, low stress, social interactions, and a whole-foods diet. Some researchers doubt this claim, but the lifestyle characteristics of these regions are promoted through the Blue Zones Project to improve community health.

author: Dave Hodges; February 1
title: BORDER PATROL SIDING WITH TX NATIONAL GUARD AND DEFIES BIDEN AND THE SUPREME COURT
text:
The Common Sense Show is dedicated to peaceful, non-violent social and political change.
To comment, you must Log In or Register
Dave Hodges has been publishing the Common Sense Show since 2012. The Common Sense Show features a wide variety of important topics that range from the loss of constitutional liberties, to the subsequent implementation of a police state under world governance, to exploring the limits of human potential. The primary purpose of The Common Sense Show is to provide Americans with the tools necessary to reclaim both our individual and national sovereignty.
